translation: Immediately then the forms again increased greatly.40.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰੀਂ ਸੰਘਰਿ ਰਚਿਅਾ; ਢੋਲ ਸੰਖ ਨਗਾਰੇ ਵਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Soorisanhar(i) Rachiaa Dhol Sankh Nagdare Vaae Kai||
translation: Sounding their drums, conches and trumpets, the warriors have begun the war.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਡ ਚਿਤਾਰੀ ਕਾਲਕਾ; ਮਨ ਬਹਲਾ ਰੋਸ ਬਢਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Channd Chitaarikaalkaa Baahlaa Ros Badhaae Kai||
translation: Chandi, being highly enraged, remembered Kali in her mind.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਕਲੀ ਮੱਥਾ ਫੋੜਿ ਕੈ; ਜਣ ਫਤੇ ਨੀਸਾਣ ਬਜਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Niklimatthaa Phod(i) Kai Jan Phate Neesaan Bajaae Kai||
translation: She came out shattering the forehead of Chandi, sounding the trumpet and flying flag of victory.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਗ ਸੁ ਜੰਮੀ ਜੁੱਧ ਨੂੰ; ਜਰਵਾਣਾ ਜਣ ਮਰੜਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Jaag Su Janmijuddh Noon Jarvaanaa Jaan Mar-daae Kai||
translation: On manifesting herself, she marched for war, like Bir Bhadra manifesting from Shiva.

gurmukhi: ਦਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਘੇਰਾ ਘੱਤਿਅਾ; ਜਣ ਸੀਹ ਤੁਰਿਅਾ ਗਣਿਣਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Dal Vich(i) Gheraa Ghattiaa Jan Seenh Turiaa Gadinaae Kai||
translation: The battlefield was surrounded by her and she seemed moving like a roaring lion.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪ ਵਿਸੂਲਾ ਹੋੲਿਅਾ; ਤਿਹੁ ਲੋਕਾਂ ਤੇ ਖੁਨਸਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Aap Visoolaa Hoiaa Tih(u) Lokaan Te Khounsaae Kai||
translation: (The demon-king) himself was in great anguish, while exhibiting his anger over the three worlds.

gurmukhi: ਰੋਹ ਸਿਧਾੲੀਅਾਂ ਚਕ੍ਰਪਾਣ; ਕਰ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਖੜਗ ੳੁਠਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Roh Sidhaaeeaan Charka Paan Kar Nindaa Khadag Outhaae Kai||
translation: Durga, being enraged, hath marched, holding her disc in her hand and raising her sword.

gurmukhi: ਅਗੈ ਰਾਕਸ ਬੈਠੇ ਰੋਹਲੇ; ਤੀਰੀ ਤੇਗੀ ਛਹਬਰ ਲਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Agad Raakas Baithe Rohale Teerigegichhabbar Laae Kai||
translation: There before her there were infuriated demons, she caught and knocked down the demons.

gurmukhi: ਪਕੜ ਪਛਾੜੇ ਰਾਕਸਾਂ; ਦਲ ਦੈਤਾ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Pakar Pachhaade Raakasaan Dal Daitaan Andar(i) Jaae Kai||
translation: Going within the forces of demons, she caught and knocked down the demons.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਕੇਸੀ ਪਕੜਿ ਪਛਾੜਿਅਨਿ; ਤਿਨ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਧੂਮ ਰਚਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Bahu Kesipakad(i) Pachhaadian(i) Tin Andar(i) Dhoom Rachaae Kai||
translation: She threw down by catching them from their hair and raising a tumult among their forces.

gurmukhi: ਬਡੇ ਬਡੇ ਚੁਣ ਸੂਰਮੇ; ਗਹਿ ਕੋਟੀ ਦੲੇ ਚਲਾੲਿ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Bade Bade Choun Soorme Gad(i) Kotidae Chadhaae Kai||
translation: She picked up mighty fighters by catching them with the corner of her bow and throwing them;
In her fury, Kali hath done this in the battlefield.41.
